bibl.title: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, December 14, 1949

div1.p: Siler encloses minutes of the Walter Reed Memorial Association and asks Hench to review them.

div1.head: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, December 14, 1949
div1.opener:
2220 - 20th Street N.W.
Washington 9, D.C.
December 14, 1949.
Dr. Philip S. Hench
The Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I beg to enclose herewith a copy of the minutes of the annual
meeting of the Board of Managers, Walter Reed Memorial Association, held
on November 23rd, 1949.

It is requested that any errors, omissions or suggested amend-
ments be reported to the Secretary of the Board for incorporation in the
permanent record.

The special attention of the members of the Board is invited
to the fact that the installation of the bronze plaque at Ft. Lesley
McNair was approved but that the actual purchase was to be held in abey-
ance temporarily, for further consideration of the exact wording to be
used. As will be noted in the minutes, it was suggested, originally, that
the wording of the inscription be as follows:
WALTER REED
died in this building
then a hospital
Nov 23 - 1902
It was suggested, at the meeting, that it might be possible to so change
the wording on the plaque as to more definitely assure retention of the
plaque at its proposed site or provision of a suitable plaque, if and
when the existing building is replaced.

It is requested that the members of the Board give this matter
consideration and submit to the Secretary their suggestions as to change
in the wording. It is suggested that some such wording as the following
might better meet the requirements.
WALTER REED
died in a hospital
on this site
Nov 23 - 1902
While Major Reed died in the building now on the site, it is and has been
an apartment house for many years and has completely lost its identity as
a hospital.

Your suggestions are requested concerning the exact wording as
it is desired that the plaque be purchased and installed without delay.

closer.signed:
J. F. Siler
Col., M.C., U.S.A., Retired
Secretary, Walter Reed
Memorial Association
